latest.title: Notification of contract wins
latest.content:
Today 07:00
RNS Number : 4914S
RTC Group PLC
11 February 2026
The information contained within this announcement is deemed by the Company to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 as it forms part of United Kingdom domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended by virtue of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019. Upon publication of this Announcement, this information is now considered to be in the public domain.
11 February 2026
RTC Group Plc
("RTC", "the Company" or "the Group")
Notification of contract wins
RTC Group Plc (AIM: RTC.L) is pleased to announce that its wholly owned subsidiary, Ganymede Solutions Limited ("Ganymede"), has been awarded new and extended contracts with major UK infrastructure and energy clients, further strengthening the Group's position as a key delivery partner in the upgrade and maintenance of critical national infrastructure; and consistent with the Group's key strategy of developing and retaining longer term earnings streams.
1. Southern Renewals Enterprise ("SRE") 8 Year Labour Supply Contract
Ganymede has been awarded a long-term contract to supply safety critical and contingent labour resources to the Southern Renewals Enterprise.
The SRE is a 10-year, £9 billion collaborative delivery model, established in April 2024, focused on infrastructure upgrades across Network Rail's Southern region including Kent, Sussex and Wessex. SRE brings together Network Rail and key partners VolkerFitzpatrick, Octavius, AtkinsRéalis, and VolkerRail to drive enhanced efficiencies in multi-disciplinary renewals through to 2034.
Under this award, Ganymede will support the SRE by providing supply of safety critical personnel and contingent labour resources throughout the term of the contract.
2. E.ON Smart Meter Engineers Contract Extension
Ganymede has secured a 12-month extension to its existing contract with E.ON, under which Ganymede continues to supply smart meter engineers to support E.ON's national energy metering operations.
This contract award and extension further underline ongoing confidence from major UK infrastructure and energy clients in Ganymede's capabilities to deliver highly skilled technical, safety critical and contingent workforce solutions across both rail and energy sectors. They demonstrate RTC's sustained market positioning and operational strength in supporting the upgrade and maintenance of the UK's critical infrastructure.
As is customary in the industry, and consistent with RTC's other contracts, these new contract wins are framework contracts with no minimum volumes or guarantee of revenue.
~ Ends ~
Enquiries:
RTC Group Plc
Tel: 01332 861 816
Andy Pendlebury, Chairman and Chief Executive
www.rtcgroupplc.co.uk
Contact Us - RTC Group Plc
SPARK Advisory Partners Limited (Nominated Adviser)
Matt Davis / James Keeshan
www.Sparkadvisorypartners.com
Tel: 0203 368 3550
Zeus (Broker)
Mike Coe / James Bavister (Investment Banking)
Nick Searle (Sales)
www.zeuscapital.co.uk
Tel: 020 3829 5000
About RTC
RTC Group Plc is an AIM listed recruitment business that focuses on white and blue-collar recruitment, providing temporary and permanent labour to a broad range of industries and customers in both domestic and international markets through its geographically defined operating divisions.
UK division
Through its Ganymede and ATA brands the Group provides a wide range of recruitment services to the following sectors in the UK:
• Rail
• Energy and utilities
• Manufacturing and engineering
• Water and environment
• Transportation
• Highways
• Construction
Ganymede specialise in recruiting the best technical and engineering talent and providing complete workforce solutions to help build and maintain infrastructure and transportation for a wide range of UK and international clients. Ganymede is a market leader in providing a diverse range of people solutions to the rail, energy, construction, highways and transportation sectors. With offices strategically located across the country, Ganymede provides its clients with the benefit of a national network of skilled personnel combined with local expertise.
ATA Recruitment provide high-quality technical recruitment solutions to the manufacturing, engineering and technology sectors. Working as an engineering recruitment partner supporting businesses across the UK and Europe, ATA Recruitment has a strong track record of attracting and recruiting the best engineering talent for our clients. ATA's regional offices which are strategically located in Leicester and Leeds each have dedicated market-experts to ensure ATA delivers excellence to both our clients and candidates.
International division
Through its GSS brand the Group works with customers across the globe that are focused on delivering projects in a variety of engineering sectors. GSS has a track record of delivery in some of the world's most hostile locations. Working closely with its customers GSS provides contract and permanent staffing solutions on an international basis, providing key personnel into new projects and supporting ongoing large-scale project staffing needs. GSS typically recruit across a range of disciplines and skills from operators and supervisors, through to senior management level.
The Group headquarters are located at the Derby Conference Centre which also provides office accommodation for its operating divisions in addition to generating rental and conferencing income from space not utilised by the Group.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact
rns@lseg.com
or visit

RTC Group PLC
17 December 2025
Certain information contained within this Announcement is deemed by the Company to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 ("MAR") as applied in the United Kingdom. Upon publication of this Announcement, this information is now considered to be in the public domain.
17 December 2025
RTC Group Plc
("RTC", "the Company" or "the Group")
Director shareholding
The Company has received notice that today, Nick Spoliar, a director of the Company, acquired 5,072 Ordinary Shares at a price of 97.2 pence per share.
Nick's total holding is 5,072 Ordinary Shares representing 0.04% of the issued share capital of the Company.

latest.title: Trading Update and Notice of Results
latest.content:
26 Nov 2025 07:00
RNS Number : 9720I
RTC Group PLC
26 November 2025
The information contained within this announcement is deemed by the Company to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 as it forms part of United Kingdom domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended by virtue of the Market Abuse (Amendment) (EU Exit) Regulations 2019. Upon publication of this Announcement, this information is now considered to be in the public domain.
26 November 2025
RTC Group Plc
("RTC", "the Company" or "the Group")
Trading Update and Notice of Results
RTC Group Plc (AIM:RTC.L) is pleased to announce that, despite a challenging UK economy which has impacted recruitment generally, and the significant additional cost burdens imposed by the government's decision to increase employers' national insurance contributions in the Autumn Budget 2024, the Group's expects to deliver a set of results for the year ending 31 December 2025, that are broadly in line with last year.
Whilst there is a broad feeling of uncertainty across many industry sectors in the United Kingdom, we firmly believe that our group business model of building long-term strategic relationships with blue chip clients, in both domestic and international markets, will continue to provide long-term order book opportunities for RTC, as many of our clients are committed to extended investment horizons.
We believe that our Group's strong and proven capabilities in relation to strategically important assets on which the country depends will ensure value longevity for our shareholders across a broad range of long-term investment programmes and for an extended period into the future.
Whilst we note the current well-advertised softness in the rail sector, an important area for our company, the healthy progress made by our energy business in particular, is a strong validation of the successful diversified strategy pursued by the Group for a number of years. We therefore remain cautiously optimistic of our future prospects as the 2025 trading period comes to a close.
At the 2025 AGM the Company outlined plans to drive increased shareholder engagement. As part of this process, we have engaged Investor Meet, a UK based platform which connects public companies and investors digitally for live and on-demand presentations and Q&A sessions.
O
ur first investor briefing through that medium will be following the release of our audited results announcement for the year ended 31 December 2025, on or around 23 March 2026. Beyond this, we are strongly committed to ensuring the availability of broker's research both to our shareholders and to the broader investment community following the announcement of our 2025 results.
Andy Pendlebury, Chairman and CEO, said:
"I am delighted the Group expects to deliver such a strong set of results given the current market conditions. Results which will further exhibit the resilience and potential of our operations.
I believe the Group has continued to demonstrate the strength of its offering through its strong and growing order book across its key target markets. Our balance sheet continues to operate free of term debt, enhancing year-on-year earnings and net value per share for its shareholders and positioning us well to take advantage of growth opportunities as they arise.
At both Group and subsidiary level, we have strong management teams who have continued to navigate market challenges and opportunities to a high degree of effectiveness.
Our Group, whilst mindful of the uncertainties facing both the domestic and global economy, has many reasons to remain positive about its future prospects '
~ Ends ~

With offices strategically located across the country, Ganymede provides its clients with the benefit of a national network of skilled personnel combined with local expertise.
ATA Recruitment provide high-quality technical recruitment solutions to the manufacturing, engineering and technology sectors. Working as an engineering recruitment partner supporting businesses across the UK and Europe, ATA Recruitment has a strong track record of attracting and recruiting the best engineering talent for our clients. ATA's regional offices which are strategically located in Leicester and Leeds each have dedicated market-experts to ensure ATA delivers excellence to both our clients and candidates.
International division
Through its GSS brand the Group works with customers across the globe that are focused on delivering projects in a variety of engineering sectors. latest.title: Replacement: Board Change
latest.content:
30 Oct 2025 14:44
RNS Number : 5613F
RTC Group PLC
30 October 2025
This announcement replaces the RNS released on 28/10/2025 (RNS number: 1321F) which contained incorrect contact details. All other information remains unchanged.
Certain information contained within this Announcement is deemed by the Company to constitute inside information as stipulated under the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No. 596/2014 ("MAR") as applied in the United Kingdom. Upon publication of this Announcement, this information is now considered to be in the public domain.
30 October 2025
RTC Group Plc
("RTC", "the Company" or "the Group")
Board Change
The Board of RTC announces that Wayne Thornhill, Non-Executive Director, has given notice to resign from the Board of Directors for personal reasons, effective 28 November 2025. The Company is currently collating a short-list of suitably qualified candidates to replace Wayne and will make a further announcement in due course.
Andy Pendlebury, Chairman and Chief Executive, said:
"On behalf of the Board, I would like to place on record the Board's thanks for Wayne's contributions to the Group. He leaves RTC with our best wishes. "
~ Ends ~
Enquiries:
RTC Group Plc
Tel: 01332 861 816

company_30s.what_they_do: RTC delivers custom IT and software development services to corporate and public‑sector clients, helping them build and maintain digital solutions.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The tech‑services market is worth billions, and small, nimble firms can win large contracts and scale quickly when the right opportunities arrive.
company_30s.current_state: The firm has recently turned its results around, secured new contracts, and refreshed its board.  It is trading near its lowest levels, suggesting a potential bottoming point.

rns_narrative: The company just announced several new contract wins that should lift revenue and earnings.
A board overhaul and new director shareholding signal fresh governance and confidence from insiders.
Interim results and AGM outcomes show a shift toward profitability and a possible dividend reinstatement.
Overall, the news paints a picture of a business that has survived a tough period and is now positioned for a rebound.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Radio silence – nobody is talking about the stock.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bulls are visible – the market has ignored the upside potential.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bears are still pessimistic, but that just means the market hasn’t yet seen the bottom.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The market moved from complete silence to the first hints of bottoming, creating a classic contrarian window.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends are flat – no public interest, so the next news event could trigger a surprise move.

near_term_catalysts: First quarterly earnings report – any upside surprises will fuel a bounce.
Announcement of a dividend or share buy‑back would signal confidence.
A new large contract or extension could lift revenue expectations.
A volume spike on the chart could confirm short covering and a price move.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for daily close above the 0.5p level with a 10‑day volume average spike, and for any short‑covering activity (e.g., a sudden rise in short interest turnover).
expect_next.timing_regime: We appear to be in a late‑stage washout: the market has fully capitulated and is now primed for a contrarian rebound.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – the stock shows a deep crash and emerging catalysts.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: Green‑level signals historically bounce around 39% on average.  With the company’s new contracts and board changes, a 50% recovery would double the price from its current level – a 1:5 upside relative to a modest downside.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: If the earnings miss expectations or the new contracts fall through, the stock could fall another 20% – but 80%+ of the original value has already been wiped out.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 20% down versus reward 100% up = 1:5 asymmetry.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter with 25% of the target position now, then add another 25% if the price closes above 0.5p with higher volume.  Place a tight stop 10% below the entry to protect against a false breakout.
playbook.if_watching: Hold until you see a daily close above 0.5p with volume at least 1.5× the 10‑day average, or until the earnings report confirms upside.  No entry before that.
playbook.if_passing: Skip if any new regulatory or financial red flags appear (e.g., insolvency filings).  Otherwise, the setup remains attractive.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep crash with contract wins and board refresh – classic contrarian play with a 1:5 risk/reward.
